-- Hoogle documentation, generated by Haddock
-- See Hoogle, http://www.haskell.org/hoogle/


-- | cpp-style built-in macros using Template Haskell
--   
@package pseudomacros
@version 0.0.2


-- | The pseudo-macros in this module are meant to be used via Template
--   Haskell (see
--   <a>http://www.haskell.org/ghc/docs/latest/html/users_guide/template-haskell.html</a>
--   for more information).
--   
--   Example:
--   
--   <pre>
--   {-# LANGUAGE TemplateHaskell #-}
--   import PseudoMacros
--   
--   main :: IO ()
--   main = putStrLn ("Hello from " ++ $__FILE__ ++ ", line " ++ show $__LINE__ ++ "!")
--   </pre>
--   
--   That is, enable the <tt>TemplateHaskell</tt> extension and put a
--   <tt>$</tt> before each pseudo-macro.
module PseudoMacros

-- | A string containing the current file name.
__FILE__ :: Q Exp

-- | An integer containing the current line number.
__LINE__ :: Q Exp

-- | A string containing the current module name.
__MODULE__ :: Q Exp

-- | A string containing the current package name.
__PACKAGE__ :: Q Exp

-- | A string containing the current date in the format <i>YYYY-MM-DD</i>.
__DATE__ :: Q Exp

-- | A string containing the current time in the format <i>HH:MM:SS</i>.
__TIME__ :: Q Exp
